resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

worklogs.comment:
wesm commented on pull request #3901: ARROW-4873: [C++] Do not override user-supplied ARROW_PACKAGE_PREFIX with ENV{CONDA_PREFIX} by default
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3901
 
 
   This covers the "hybrid" developer case where the library toolchain is maintained externally, but the Python bits are managed by an active conda environment. 
   
   If everything is in the conda environment (C++ libraries, etc.) then the out-of-the-box behavior will elect to use `$CONDA_PREFIX` for `ARROW_PACKAGE_PREFIX`
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

wesm commented on issue #3901: ARROW-4873: [C++] Do not override user-supplied ARROW_PACKAGE_PREFIX with ENV{CONDA_PREFIX} by default
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3901#issuecomment-473030207
 
 
   Hm this seems to break the Windows builds. I'll take a closer look...
   
   https://ci.appveyor.com/project/wesm/arrow/builds/23076536
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

bkietz commented on issue #3901: ARROW-4873: [C++] Do not override user-supplied ARROW_PACKAGE_PREFIX with ENV{CONDA_PREFIX} by default
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3901#issuecomment-473038282
 
 
   @wesm I'm seeing a similar error to [this](https://ci.appveyor.com/project/wesm/arrow/builds/23076536/job/8g3cgnki8r03i4x8#L527), it seems that some of the conda dependencies don't have a `Find<dep>.cmake` in `$CONDA_PREFIX/share/cmake-3.13/Modules`, so setting `<dep>_ROOT` isn't getting picked up by anything. This was (hackily) fixed by passing `-D<dep>_DIR=$CONDA_PREFIX/<path to depConfig.cmake` 
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

bkietz commented on issue #3901: ARROW-4873: [C++] Do not override user-supplied ARROW_PACKAGE_PREFIX with ENV{CONDA_PREFIX} by default
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3901#issuecomment-473038282
 
 
   @wesm I'm seeing a similar error to [this](https://ci.appveyor.com/project/wesm/arrow/builds/23076536/job/8g3cgnki8r03i4x8#L527), it seems that some of the conda dependencies don't have a `Find<dep>.cmake` in `$CONDA_PREFIX/share/cmake-3.13/Modules`, so setting `<dep>_ROOT` isn't getting picked up by anything. This was (hackily) fixed by passing `-D<dep>_DIR=$CONDA_PREFIX/<path to directory containing depConfig.cmake>` 
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

bkietz commented on issue #3901: ARROW-4873: [C++] Do not override user-supplied ARROW_PACKAGE_PREFIX with ENV{CONDA_PREFIX} by default
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3901#issuecomment-473046539
 
 
   In your case, it looks like `FindDoubleConversion.cmake` is looking for [DoubleConversion_ROOT](https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/5114be6/cpp/cmake_modules/FindDoubleConversion.cmake#L18) but `ThirdPartyToolchain.cmake` is setting [double-conversion_ROOT](https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/ef619dd128c938ea24cb2df813d3df81b183c173/cpp/cmake_modules/ThirdpartyToolchain.cmake#L91)
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

wesm commented on issue #3901: ARROW-4873: [C++] Do not override user-supplied ARROW_PACKAGE_PREFIX with ENV{CONDA_PREFIX} by default
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3901#issuecomment-473070098
 
 
   @xhochy This removes the logic that overrides the AUTO default dependency source when $CONDA_PREFIX is set. I think that we should make -DARROW_DEPENDENCY_SOURCE=CONDA explicit

wesm commented on issue #3901: ARROW-4873: [C++] Do not override user-supplied ARROW_PACKAGE_PREFIX with ENV{CONDA_PREFIX} by default
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3901#issuecomment-473109251
 
 
   The modules should be in `$CONDA_PREFIX/lib/cmake` or `$CONDA_PREFIX/lib/pkgconfig` not `share/cmake-3.13`. For me it seems to be building Flatbuffers from source. I'll comment in ARROW-4879

xhochy commented on pull request #3901: ARROW-4873: [C++] Do not override user-supplied ARROW_PACKAGE_PREFIX with ENV{CONDA_PREFIX} by default
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3901#discussion_r265903999
 
 

 ##########
 File path: cpp/cmake_modules/ThirdpartyToolchain.cmake
 ##########
 @@ -59,12 +56,16 @@ set(ARROW_THIRDPARTY_DEPENDENCIES
   BOOST)
 
 # TODO: double-conversion check fails for conda, it should not
-if(ARROW_DEPENDENCY_SOURCE STREQUAL "CONDA")
+if (ARROW_DEPENDENCY_SOURCE STREQUAL "CONDA")
   message(STATUS "Using CONDA_PREFIX: $ENV{CONDA_PREFIX}")
   set(ARROW_PACKAGE_PREFIX $ENV{CONDA_PREFIX})
   set(ARROW_ACTUAL_DEPENDENCY_SOURCE "SYSTEM")
+else()
+  set(ARROW_ACTUAL_DEPENDENCY_SOURCE "${ARROW_DEPENDENCY_SOURCE}")
 endif()
 
+message(STATUS "Using ${ARROW_ACTUAL_DEPENDENCY_SOURCE} approach to find dependencies")
 
 Review comment:
   Moving this message here, we should also add a messge when the `CONDA_PREFIX` was applied.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

xhochy commented on pull request #3901: ARROW-4873: [C++] Do not override user-supplied ARROW_PACKAGE_PREFIX with ENV{CONDA_PREFIX} by default
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3901#discussion_r265903771
 
 

 ##########
 File path: cpp/CMakeLists.txt
 ##########
 @@ -194,16 +194,15 @@ static|shared (default shared)")
   # * SYSTEM: Use CMake's find_package and find_library without any custom
   #   paths. If packages are on non-default locations, let the user indicate it
   #   from the outside using the *_ROOT variables.
-  #   If your system packages are in general in a non-default location, you can
-  #   set a general default for the *_ROOT variables using ARROW_PACKAGE_PREFIX.
-  # * CONDA: Same as system but set all *_ROOT variables to ENV{CONDA_PREFIX}.
+  #   If your system packages are in general in a non-default location, or if
+  #   you are using a non-standard toolchain, you can set a general default for
+  #   the *_ROOT variables using ARROW_PACKAGE_PREFIX.
+  # * CONDA: Same as system but set all *_ROOT variables to
+  #   ENV{CONDA_PREFIX}. If this is run within an active conda environment,
+  #   then ENV{CONDA_PREFIX} will be used for dependencies unless
+  #   ARROW_DEPENDENCY_SOURCE is set explicitly to one of the other options
   # * BREW: Use SYSTEM but search for select packages with brew.
-  if(NOT "$ENV{CONDA_PREFIX}" STREQUAL "")
 
 Review comment:
   I would actually like to keep this as the main strategy. Having conda packages and the build toolchain split is something that I would only advise to expert users since the compiler migration. With the new toolchain using system compilers, binutils, … is going to be a pain unless one is on a brand new system. I rather have CMake error out on missing conda packages than weird compilers as the binutils/compiler/ABI is not matching.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3901#discussion_r265975770
 
 

 ##########
 File path: cpp/CMakeLists.txt
 ##########
 @@ -194,16 +194,15 @@ static|shared (default shared)")
   # * SYSTEM: Use CMake's find_package and find_library without any custom
   #   paths. If packages are on non-default locations, let the user indicate it
   #   from the outside using the *_ROOT variables.
-  #   If your system packages are in general in a non-default location, you can
-  #   set a general default for the *_ROOT variables using ARROW_PACKAGE_PREFIX.
-  # * CONDA: Same as system but set all *_ROOT variables to ENV{CONDA_PREFIX}.
+  #   If your system packages are in general in a non-default location, or if
+  #   you are using a non-standard toolchain, you can set a general default for
+  #   the *_ROOT variables using ARROW_PACKAGE_PREFIX.
+  # * CONDA: Same as system but set all *_ROOT variables to
+  #   ENV{CONDA_PREFIX}. If this is run within an active conda environment,
+  #   then ENV{CONDA_PREFIX} will be used for dependencies unless
+  #   ARROW_DEPENDENCY_SOURCE is set explicitly to one of the other options
   # * BREW: Use SYSTEM but search for select packages with brew.
-  if(NOT "$ENV{CONDA_PREFIX}" STREQUAL "")
 
 Review comment:
   Alright, I can write `-DARROW_DEPENDENCY_SOURCE=SYSTEM -DARROW_PACKAGE_PREFIX=$TOOLCHAIN` in the meantime
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
